gurmukhi: hY pRsMnX sB biRj bDU iqh ko sIs invwie ]pr pwien kr bynqI clI giHn kO Dwie ]289]
transliteration: Hai Prasannya Sabh Brij-badhoo Tih Ko Sees Nivaae|| Par Paain Kar Bentichaligrihan Kau Dhaae||289||
translation: All the young women of Braja, getting pleased and bowing their heads and touching the feet of the goddess, went to their own homes.289.

gurmukhi: Awps mY kr jor sBY gupIAw cil Dwm geI hrKwnI ]rIJ dXo hm ko durgw br sXwm clI khqI ieh bwnI ]
transliteration: Oopas Mai Kar Jor Sabhai Ougpeeaa Chal(i) Dhaam Gadharkhaanee|| Reejh Dayo Ham Ko Durgad Bar Syaam Chalikahtieh Baanee||
translation: All the gopis, catching the hands of one another, went to their homes, with happiness in their minds; they were all saying this, that Durga, having been pleased, has bestowed on all of us Krishna as our bridegroom;

gurmukhi: AwnMd m`q BrI md so sB suMdr Dwmn ko inj kwnI ]dwn dXo idjhUM bhuqXo mn ie`Cq hY hir ho hm jwnI ]290]
transliteration: Oonand Matt Bharimad So Sabh Soundar Dhaamanndko Nij Kaanee|| Daan Dayo Dij-hoon Bahoutyo Man Ichchhat Man Ichchhat Hai Har(i) Ho Ham Jaanee||290||
translation: And filled with this delilght, all those beautiful ladies reached their homes, they gave abundance of charity to Brahmins, because they had obtained their Krishna, as desired by their heart.290.

gurmukhi: smY BlY iek Gwq isau hÍY iekqR sB bwl ]AMg sBY gnnY lgI kirkY bwq rswl ]291]
transliteration: Samai Bhalai Ik Ghaat Sio Hvai Ikatra Sa Baal|| An Sabhai Gad-nai Lagikar(i)kai Baat Rasaal||291||
translation: On one occasion, all the girls (gopis) talking together sweetly began to describe various limbs of Krishna.291.

gurmukhi: koaU khY hir ko muK suMdr koaU khY suB nwk bnXo hY ]koaU khY kt kyhir sI qn kMcn so irJ kwhU gnXo hY ]
transliteration: Ko( i)  Kahai Har(i) Ko Moukh Soundar Ko( i)  Kahai Soubh Naak Banyo Hai|| Ko( i)  Kahai Kat Kehar(i) Sitan Kanchanndso Rijh Kaahoo Gadyo Hai||
translation: Someone says that the face of Krishna is captivating; someone says that the nostril of Krishna is winsome; someone says with pleasure that the waist of Krishna is like a lion; and some says that the body of Krishna is made of gold;

gurmukhi: nYn kurMg sy koaU gnY js qw Cib ko kib sXwm BnXo hY ]logn mY ijmu jIv bnXo iqn ky qn mY iqm kwnH mnXo hY ]292]
transliteration: Nain Kuran Se Ko( i)  Gadai Jas Taa Chhab(i) Ko Kabi Syaam Bhanyo Hai|| Logad Mai Jim(u) Jeev Banyo Tin Ke Tan Mai Tim Kaahn Manyo Hai||292||
translation: Someone gives the simile of doe for the eyes and the poet Shyam says that like the soul pervading the bodies of the human being, Krishna pervades in the minds of all the gopis.292.

gurmukhi: kwnH ko pyK klwinD so muK rIJ rhI sBhI biRj bwrw ]moih rhy Bgvwn auqY ienhUM durgw br cytk fwrw ]
transliteration: Kaahn Ko Pekh Kalaanidh So Moukh Reejh Rahisabh-hibrij Baaraa|| Moh(i) Rahe Bhagvaan Outai Inhoon Durgad Bar Chetak Daaraa||
translation: Seeing the face of Krishna like the moon, all the girls of Braja are getting pleased; on this side Krishna is allured by all the gopis and on this other side, because of the boon bestowed by Durga, gopis are feeling impatient;

gurmukhi: kwin itkY giH Aaur ibKY iqh ko Aiq hI jsu sXwm aucwrw ]jIv iekqR rhY iqnko iem tUt gey ijau miRnwl kI qwrw ]293]
transliteration: Kaan(i) Tikai Grih Aur Bikhai Tih Ko At(i) Hijas(u) Syaam Ouchaaraa|| Jeev Ikarta Rahai Tinko Im Toot Gad Jio Mrinaal Kitaaraa||293||
translation: In order to increase the impatient of the gopis, stays in some other house for some time, then the hearts of all the gopis cracked like the easy cracking of the chords of the tube of lotus.293.

gurmukhi: nyhu lgXo ien ko hir sO Aru nyhu lgXo hir ko ien nwry ]cYn prY duh kO nih dÍY pl nwvn jwvq hoq svwry ]
transliteration: Neh(u) Lagyo In Ko Har(i) Sau Ar(u) Neh(u) Lagyo Har(i) Ko In Ndare|| Chain Darai Duh Kau Nah(i) Dvai Pal Naavan Jaavat Hot Savdare||
translation: The mutual love of Krishna and gopis continued increasing; both sides are feeling restless and go to take bath several times;
